document_data.caption: [[Krigar]] the "Courageous" casts '''Sleep''' on some criminals.
document_data.name: Sleep
document_data.Users: It was used by [[wizard]]s, [[bard]]s and [[sorcerer]]s, as well as [[warlock]]s with [[Archfey patron]]s. and the [[elven]] goddess [[Sehanine Moonbow]].
document_data.Effects:
''Sleep'', as the name of the spell implies, placed its targets into a light slumber when cast successfully, overcoming the creatures' willpower. It affected a number of creatures that depended on the caster's power.

Between the [[Spellplague]] and the [[Second Sundering]], it could typically be cast only once per day and affected an area of roughly {{SI|5|feet|long=yes}} in a radius within a distance of {{SI|100|feet|long=yes}} from the caster. Creatures that managed to stave off the intended effects of the spell nonetheless found their body fatigued, slowing their movements and thought processes.
document_data.Components: The spell needed [[verbal]], [[somatic]], and [[material component]]s to be cast. The materials required were either a pinch of fine [[sand]], [[rose]] petals, or a [[cricket]], any of which could be replaced by the use of an [[arcane focus]].
document_data.History: The spell was credited to the [[Netherese arcanist]] [[Efteran]] in {{Yearlink|-1772}} and was originally called ''Efteran's sleep''.
document_data.Notable Uses: During the [[Time of Troubles]] of [[1358 DR]], at a party in [[Castle Waterdeep]], [[Kyriani]] got her boyfriend [[Fenn Estelmer]] out of her hair using a ''sleep'' applied secretly via a kiss.{{Cite comic/Dark of the Moon|7}}
